ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An improved understanding of the Spanish language in general, improved Spanish writing skills, and improved understanding of Hispanic/Latino culture
I did Lear a lot of grammar and vocabulary. The in class discussions really helped with my speaking abilities.
Improved Spanish.

I practiced using Spanish in various situations, in which I was exposed to various different cultural items from Spanish-speaking areas. Not only did we practice guided writing, reading, and listening exercises, but we also were involved in activities that required active and free recall to develop and construct responses to written or spoken prompts.
I elevated my Spanish and became more comfortable speaking in front of others.
This course really improved my conversational skills and pushed me to be more comfortable in reading, writing, and speaking.
I learned Spanish
grammar, vocabulary, speaking

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: definitive daily schedule, activities to engage all parts of Spanish learning
Weaknesses: lack of ELC options later in the semester, lack of consistency in activities across sections (ex. one section had to memorize a script for a given project while another section didnt have to memorize for the same project)
The strict grading was certainly a weakness and the variation of grading across teachers. But quality and interest of assignments and topics was great

Strengths: This course finally moves away from the textbook about a little more than halfway through the course, which is great. It also doesn't really focus on the textbook anyway, using Spanish-language world media to do most of the content bearing. The media was also pretty diverse, though I have some criticisms.

Weaknesses: Like any of the Spanish courses there's just so much work. Even with the asynchronous day it can be difficult because you always feel burnout. The book you read at the end (El relato de naufrago) is kind of boring, especially considering the author (G.G. Marquez) is actually very good. The department is also not very accommodating with missing days, which is disappointing considering the emphasis in class seems to revolve around writing as opposed to speaking, which is useful in the academic world but not where most of the use will be for the majority of people in the course, which is speaking.

The topics and larger assignments were engaging and felt more real than other language assignments Ive had. 

Supersite assignments were relatively an annoyance and there is likely a better method to learn the material because everyone is just trying to go through the supersite as fast as possible (people even find answers online unfortunately).

Strengths: experience based learning, interesting topics and conversations, collaborative environment

Weaknesses: assignments were sometimes tedious and felt like busy work
It was a good Spanish course, with interesting material

strengths: pushed for more participation, included a variety of projects; weakness: although workload was generally consistent, there were some weeks that were totally overwhelming because of an extra project on top of normally assigned homework

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if interested in Spanish or looking to fulfill the language requirement by continuing past Spanish learning.

I would to the extent that you must do well on every assignment. Know that there are wont really off days and chill assignments with this class. I think selecting a teach you like most will help enjoy and do well in the course. Know how much work you are getting into.
Absolutely because youll improve your Spanish and make some new friends since you are with the same people almost every day.
Absolutely! Especially with Juliana, you will learn a lot in this class and become very close with your other classmates. Your Spanish speaking ability will most definitely improve
Sure, it is a good Spanish class and it works.
Yes; I started the year not participating much, but I was encouraged to talk more and it really helped my Spanish speaking skills.
